definitions.definition: Another time: indicating a repeat of an action .
examples: I enjoyed it so much I went again the next day.

definitions.definition: Back (to a former place or state).
examples: We need to bring the old customs to life again .

definitions.definition: Over and above a factor of one.
examples: This stick is quite long, but that other one is half as long again .

definitions.definition: Used metalinguistically, with the repetition being in the discussion, or in the linguistic or pragmatic context of the discussion, rather than in the subject of discussion.

subdefinitions.definition: Tell me again, say again; used in asking a question to which one may have already received an answer that one cannot remember.
I ask again, I say again; used in repeating a question or statement.
examples: Again , I'm not criticizing, I just want to understand.

subdefinitions.definition: Here too, here also, in this case as well; used in applying a previously made point to a new instance; sometimes preceded by "here".
examples: Approach B is better than approach A in many respects, but again , there are difficulties in implementing it.

definitions.definition: Back in the reverse direction, or to an original starting point.
In return , as a reciprocal action; back .

main_definition: Another time: indicating a repeat of an action . [from 14 c.]
secondary_definitions: Back (to a former place or state). [from 11 c.]
Over and above a factor of one. [from 16 c.]
Used metalinguistically, with the repetition being in the discussion, or in the linguistic or pragmatic context of the discussion, rather than in the subject of discussion. [from 16 c.]
( obsolete ) Back in the reverse direction, or to an original starting point. [10 –18 c.]
( obsolete ) In return , as a reciprocal action; back . [13 –19 c.]
( Can we verify this sense?) Moreover; besides; further.
